Re: License #: CI820201488

Dear Ms. Shell:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Intervention standards and prohibitions
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited to:
1

(iii) Threats of restraint, seclusion, punishment, or otherwise
suggesting physical or emotional harm to a youth.
(iv) Verbal abuse including the use of derogatory or discriminatory
language including negative references to a youth's background or
appearance or mental state. Yelling, threats, ridicule, or
humiliation are strictly prohibited.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Staff member threatened to drag a youth, but that did not occur.
Staff used derogatory language towards youth.
Investigation On 12/30/24 Complainant 1 reported Staff 1 told Youth A she did
not have any children, and she would drag Youth A. No physical
altercation occurred. Staff 1 also called Youth A “retarded”. No
other details were known.
Interviews:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/3/25.
Youth A stated she did not have any problems with Staff 1. Youth
A could not recall any incidents where Staff 1 had called her
names or made threats.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/3/25. Staff
1 stated on the day of the alleged incident, Youth A asked to go to
the bathroom. Staff 1 asked Youth A to wait for a minute as
another staff was on their way. Youth A became agitated and said
she would cause a problem. Youth A ran to the corner and Staff 1
followed to see what she was doing. Youth A was facing the wall,
trying to get a light switch cover off. Staff 1 tried to verbally
redirect Youth A, but then called a supervisor for assistance.
Youth A stood on something and made a comment that she would
beat up staff. Staff 1 told Youth A, “do not put hands on me”. Staff
1 stated she never said what was reported. Staff 1 insisted she
only told Youth A not to put hands on her. At one point Staff 1
directed Youth A to stand up, before something else happened.
Staff 1 did not clarify what she meant by that. Staff 2 arrived on
the unit. No one else was present prior to that. Staff 1 denied
making any threats or calling Youth A any names.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/3/25. Staff
2 reported she overheard Staff 1 state, “I don’t have no kids, I will
drag you”. This occurred when Staff 2 returned to the unit. Staff 1
also threatened to slap Youth A. Staff 2 directed Staff 1 off the
unit. Staff 2 stated Staff 1 had a terrible attitude and was mean
about everything.
2

Documents reviewed:
• The human resources file for Staff 1 was reviewed:
o Staff 1 was hired on 9/25/24 and terminated on
1/16/25.
o Staff 1 completed onboarding training from 9/25/24-
10/1/24.
o Crisis Prevention Institute training was completed on
10/3/24.
o Staff 1 did not have any disciplinary action on file.
Additional Allegation:
On 12/30/24 Complainant 2 reported on 12/28/24 Staff 2 stated
to Youth A, “let me get the f***. Come over here. I have a daughter
that’s your age, 13, I will slap the f*** outta you and beat your a**.”
Nothing physical occurred between Staff 2 and Youth A.
Interviews:
Chief Administrator, Rights Officer, and Quality Manager were
contacted by email on 12/30/24 regarding the status of the
identified staff. Rights Officer responded that he was awaiting
additional information, but was informed Staff 2 was sent home
early on 12/28/24 due to an incident.
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/3/25.
Youth A reported she had a recent incident where she pulled Staff
2’s hair. Youth A became angry, and Staff 2 stated she would
“mop the floor” with her and “whoop her a**”. Youth A stated there
were no prior incidents with Staff 2. No peers were present. Youth
A was unsure what date this occurred, but it was between the
holidays.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 1/3/25. Staff
2 stated she did not have any altercations with Youth A on
12/28/24. Youth A had pulled her hair, and staff made a joke that
Youth A was jealous of how long Staff 2’s hair was. Staff 2
admitted that she told Youth A in a joking way she was “bald
headed”. Youth A laughed. Staff 2 stated she worked with Youth A
frequently as other staff did not want to. No other staff were
present for the interaction about her hair. Staff 2 denied making
the alleged comments.
Staff 3 was contacted by phone on 1/30/25. Staff 3 stated they
wrote the incident report from 12/28/24 as the information was
reported to them by Staff 4 and Staff 5. However, Staff 3 was not
3

present for the incident. Staff 3 did not have any concerns
regarding Staff 2 prior to this.
Staff 4 was interviewed by phone on 1/30/25. Staff 4 reported she
was working on the unit on 12/28/24. Staff 4 observed Youth A
was acting up and Staff 2 approached her. Youth A then pushed
Staff 2. Staff 2 yelled something about they will, “get the f*** on,
because if you hit me, I’ll beat you’re a**. I have a daughter your
age.” Staff 4 stated nothing physical happened as Staff 2 was
asked to leave the unit. Staff 4 did not have any previous
concerns about Staff 2.
Staff 5 was contacted by phone on 1/30/25. Staff 5 stated he was
working on the wing on 12/28/24. Youth A had walked off the unit
into an area she was not supposed to be in. Staff 2 tried to
redirect Youth A back to the unit. Youth A flinched at Staff 2 as if
she were going to hit her. Staff 2 responded, “oh hell no. Not
about to deal with this today.” Staff 2 then said something about
putting her hands on Youth A because she had kids her age. Staff
5 could not recall the exact wording, but did remember Staff 2
state to Youth A that, “I will slap the s*** out of you”. Staff 5 stated
that nothing physical happened and Staff 2 left the unit shortly
after. Staff 5 did not have any concerns about Staff 2 prior to this
incident.
Documents reviewed:
• Incident Report dated 12/28/24, authored by Staff 3. The
report indicated the author did not witness the event.
However, the author received information from two staff
(Staff 4 and Staff 5) that Staff 2 made verbal threats toward
Youth A. The verbal threats were as indicated in the
allegation.
• The human resources file for Staff 2 was reviewed:
o Staff 2 was hired on 10/14/24 and terminated on
1/9/25.
o Staff 2 completed onboarding training from 10/14/24
to 10/18/24.
o Safety care training occurred on 10/30/24.
o Staff 2 had one incident of disciplinary action on file:
a verbal warning on 12/3/24 regarding attendance.
Analysis No violation was found regarding the first allegation as Staff 1 and
Youth A denied the allegation. Staff 2 reported the allegation was
accurate, but there was insufficient information to corroborate their
account.
4

A violation was found regarding the second allegation as the youth
and two staff witnesses reported threatening language was used
by Staff 2, toward Youth A.
Conclusion Repeat Violation Established
SI 2025SIC0000221 dated 1/22/25, CAP pending
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. A corrective action plan is required.
